attributes.magic: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, Synopsys ARCompact ARC700 cores, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis: This RISC-V ELF binary is a malicious botnet agent, likely a variant of an IoT-focused family such as Mirai or Gafgyt. The sample contains concrete indicators of network discovery and DDoS capabilities, specifically the use of SSDP (Simple Service Discovery Protocol) 'M-SEARCH' discovery packets (Target: 255.255.255.255:1900) for identifying vulnerable UPnP devices. It also features a spoofed Windows-based User-Agent ('Google Chrome/60.0.3112.90 Windows'), which is highly anomalous for a RISC-V Linux binary and typical of malicious HTTP flooding or C2 communication. The binary collects system metadata via '/proc/stat' and '/proc/cpuinfo' and contains numerous hex-encoded strings and path templates suggesting obfuscated configuration data.
